add.does: claims a core to your account

remove.does: releases a core from your account

rename.does: changes the friendly name of your core

usage: spark flash core_id file1.ino file2.cpp file2.h file3.cpp [--usb]
does: flash remotely pushes a compiled firmware binary to one of your cores over the air, or directly
over USB / dfu.  If you send it one or more source files, or a directory of source, it will compile
that remotely first, and push the compiled binary to your core instead, or in the case of code errors
will show you the errors from the server.
You can also substitute "tinker" or "cc3000" to flash the provided app.
Subscribes to published events on the cloud, and pipes them to the console.  Special core name "mine" will subscribe to events from just your cores.

usage: spark compile file1.ino file2.cpp file2.h file3.cpp
does: Compiles one or more source files or a directory of source to a firmware binary for the Spark Core,
or in the case of code errors will display those instead.
